page.title: 19RUGBY CATTLE MARKET.
page.content: By a charter of 1255 a market for the sale of general commodities and cattle was established in certain streets in the town,the market rights being held by the Lord of the Manor. The centre of the town was closed and the accumulated filth in the streets took a week to remove. In 1878 on a site near the Midland Station,a new market opened covering approximately 8 acres of land.In 1880 the Railway Company extended their cattle sidings and sold social cheap tickets for the Rugby markets. The market has continued to grow and has become one of the largest in the midlands.Improvements have been made.Held on Mondays,although it's one of the largest markets,stock is brought in and sent away quickly.All animals and other goods have been transported by road for some time now.
